author: chucklu
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).

-->

# Steps to reproduce
The problem was found when test the Powershell code generated by Postman https://github.com/postmanlabs/postman-app-support/issues/6775
```powershell
$headers = New-Object "System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary[[String],[String]]"
$headers.Add("Accept", 'text/html')
$headers.Add("Content-Type", 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded')

$body = "billCode=75132077503374"

$response = Invoke-RestMethod 'https://hdgateway.zto.com/WayBill_GetDetail' -Method 'POST' -Headers $headers -Body $body
$response
```
Save the above Powershell code in file postman.ps1 and run the script file as
```Powershell
 .\postman.ps1 | Format-List
```

# Expected behavior
show the response correctly

# Actual behavior

```none
result     : @{prescriptionStatus=5; logisticsRecord=System.Object[]; billPrescription=1天17小时; billCode=75132077503374}
message    : 快递信息查询成功
status     : True
statusCode :
```
**logisticsRecord=System.Object[];**
The logisticsRecord property was parsed as System.Object[], it should expand to get the items in object array

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.2.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.2.0
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17763
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

The http post format
```
POST /WayBill_GetDetail HTTP/1.1
Host: hdgateway.zto.com
Accept: text/html
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

billCode=75132077503374
```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @markekraus Could you please comment the issue?

comments.author: BrucePay
comments.body:
@chucklu  The data received is turned into `PSObjects` so the logistics field _is_ an object array. The issue is that PowerShell doesn't render beyond one level by default. Try doing
```powershell
$response.result.logisticsRecord
```
and you should see what you expect.

comments.author: chucklu
comments.body:
@BrucePay  Thanks for you advice, I find a solution to the previous issue in Postman
The original Powershell code was
```Powershell
$headers = New-Object "System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary[[String],[String]]"
$headers.Add("Accept", 'text/html')
$headers.Add("Content-Type", 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded')

$body = "billCode=75132077503374"

$response = Invoke-RestMethod 'https://hdgateway.zto.com/WayBill_GetDetail' -Method 'POST' -Headers $headers -Body $body
$response | ConvertTo-Json
```
[Powershell ConvertTo-JSON missing nested level
](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22260343/powershell-convertto-json-missing-nested-level)
What I need to do is specify the depth for  ConvertTo-Json, such as 
```
$response | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 5
```

comments.author: chucklu
comments.body:
Also  find another stackoverflow summary 
[Unexpected ConvertTo-Json results? Answer: it has a default -Depth of 2](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53583677/unexpected-convertto-json-results-answer-it-has-a-default-depth-of-2)
And topic on https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/8381

title: Invoke-RestMethod can't parse object array correctly
